criteriaDocumentation.name: Non-text Content
criteriaDocumentation.shortDescription: All non-text content has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose.
criteriaDocumentation.intent: The intent of this Success Criterion is to make information conveyed by non-text content accessible through the use of a text alternative.
benefits: People who are blind or have low vision can access visual content
People who are deaf or hard of hearing can access audio content
People using text-only browsers or assistive technologies can access content

techniques.title: Providing short text alternative for non-text content
Using alt attributes on img elements
Using null alt text for decorative images
Using text alternatives that are not alternatives

epubSpecific: Use alt attribute on all img elements
Ensure SVG images have appropriate text alternatives

examples.title: Data chart
examples.description: A bar chart with short alt text and long description

examples.title: Decorative image
examples.description: An image used purely for decoration with null alt text

automated: Check that all img elements have an alt attribute
Check that alt text is not placeholder text
Verify alt text length is appropriate
manual: Review alt text for accuracy and appropriateness
Verify decorative images have null alt text
Check that complex images have adequate descriptions

remediationGuidance.explanation: Add descriptive alt text that conveys the same information as the image.

commonIssues: Alt text is just the filename
Decorative images not marked as decorative

criteriaDocumentation.name: Info and Relationships
criteriaDocumentation.shortDescription: Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text.
criteriaDocumentation.intent: The intent of this Success Criterion is to ensure that information and relationships that are implied by visual or auditory formatting are preserved when the presentation format changes.
benefits: People using screen readers can understand document structure
People who use different style sheets can maintain understanding
Content can be presented in different ways without losing meaning

techniques.title: Using ol, ul and dl for lists
Using table markup for tabular data
Using structural markup that does not represent relationships

epubSpecific: Use semantic HTML elements for structure
Use EPUB:type attributes for additional semantics

examples.title: Form with labels
examples.description: Form controls with properly associated labels

examples.title: Data table
examples.description: Table with proper headers and associations

automated: Check form controls have associated labels
manual: Review that visual structure matches semantic structure
Check that content makes sense when linearized

remediationGuidance.explanation: Use semantic heading elements instead of styled divs to convey document structure.

commonIssues: Using styled text instead of semantic headings

criteriaDocumentation.name: Contrast (Minimum)
criteriaDocumentation.shortDescription: Text and images of text have a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1.
criteriaDocumentation.intent: The intent of this Success Criterion is to provide enough contrast between text and its background so that it can be read by people with moderately low vision.
benefits: People with low vision can read text more easily
People with color deficiencies can distinguish text from background
Content is more readable in various lighting conditions

techniques.title: Using text that does not meet contrast requirements

epubSpecific: Ensure CSS color and background-color have sufficient contrast
Check contrast in all reading modes
Consider publisher and reading system CSS interactions

examples.title: High contrast text
examples.description: Black text on white background (21:1 ratio)

automated: Check all text elements for contrast ratio
Identify text that falls below 4.5:1 threshold
manual: Check contrast in different color modes
Verify text over images has sufficient contrast

remediationGuidance.explanation: Darken the text color to achieve at least 4.5:1 contrast ratio with the background.

commonIssues: Light gray text on white background
Links that don't stand out from body text
